messages.title: A strong voice for Nottingham South
messages.content: I've been incredibly proud to serve Nottingham South in Parliament since 2010 and I've worked hard to keep the promises I made to you - standing up for our public services and fighting for investments in our city's housing, roads and railways. But over the past 5 years the Tories and Lib Dems have taken Britain backwards - people are worse off, life is tougher for young people, and our health service is in crisis. For a better future, Nottingham South needs a Labour MP and Britain needs a Labour Government - with a better plan for living standards, the next generation and our NHS. I hope you'll vote for me again on 7 May. Together we can make our city an even better place to live and work.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Fight for our NHS to ensure Nottingham residents get the high-quality care they need at home, in the community and in our hospitals.
Support Labour's plans to make work pay by raising the Minimum Wage and banning exploitative zero-hours contracts.
Campaign for an end to cold homes and roll-out the city's successful insulation scheme to residents across Nottingham.
Work hard to ensure that every Nottingham child gets a good education and our young people have access to jobs and training.
